Sentencas: The evolution of gases from direct utilization of carbon in a solid oxide fuel cell (C-SOFC) was studied by potentiostatic/galvanostatic discharge of a fuel cell with coconut carbon, a carbonaceous material with low ash and sulfur content.
Titulo: Analysis of gas products from direct utilization of carbon in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Operation of C-SOFC at 750 degrees C produced less CO and more CO2 than those predicted by thermodynamic calculation using total Gibbs free energy minimization method.
Titulo: Analysis of gas products from direct utilization of carbon in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The addition of CO2 to the anode chamber increased CO formation and maximum power density from 0.09W cm(-2) to 0.13W cm(-2), indicating the occurrence of Boudouard reaction (CO2 + C double left right arrow 2CO) coupling with CO electrochemical oxidation on the C-SOFC.
Titulo: Analysis of gas products from direct utilization of carbon in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Analysis of CO and CO2 concentration as a function of current and voltage revealed that electricity was mainly produced from the electrochemical oxidation of carbon at low current density and produced from the electrochemical oxidation of CO at high current density.
Titulo: Analysis of gas products from direct utilization of carbon in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The results suggest the electrochemical oxidation of solid carbon is more mass transfer limited than electrochemical oxidation of CO. (C) 2012
Titulo: Analysis of gas products from direct utilization of carbon in a solid oxide fuel cell
Analysis of gas products from direct utilization of carbon in a solid oxide fuel cell
